title: When the Pope Was Almost Snatched in 1981
story: [dramatic] Imagine this: on May 13, 1981, in St. Peter's Square, Pope John Paul II was shot four times! [pause:0.5s] As chaos erupted, a heroic bystander, Anna de Fiori, intervened, tackling the assassin, Mehmet Ali Ağca, before he could drag the Pope away. [pause:1s] This shocking moment left 100,000 spectators frozen in disbelief. [pause:0.5s] If Anna hadn’t acted, it could have changed the papacy forever, influencing global politics and religious dialogue. [pause:1s] How close did we come to a different history?
description: In 1981, a brave bystander saved the Pope from a shocking kidnapping attempt! How close were we to a new chapter in history? #PopeJohnPaulII #History #AssassinationAttempt
